description: Love this app as a quick notation app, but it can use a better vanilla soundfont
Very complete and stable.
MuseScore 3 has brought many great improvements to MuseScore, which has already been the greatest music notation platform ever.
This app does just what itsays and plays fine on my modern Fedora 30 box. Thanks.
It's a great piece of software for making music in. But you really need to use the Flatpak version if you want things to work well.
summary: Make sure to use the Flatpak version

description: good software
Get the snap one instead.

I used Musescore for a while now, it's easy to use and great for beginners. However, it may crash at any time. Another issue with this app is when you try to save a file, instead of only typing the name of the file you want to save, you will also need to type the extension for that specific file.
summary: Great app, but it has issues with stability

description:
This app has been here a while, and the effort is something to be appreciated.

It is among the top 10 open source apps of all time in my opinion.

It does what it says on the box. There's room for improvement, but try finding a better one with the same license.
Best music application ever on Linux

I've been continuosly using Musescore since 2019. It is undoubtedly one of the best music notation app as well as the best FOSS software for the purpose. Today I tried to install it via GNOME Software (Fedora 36) and it hung up displaying "Preparing..." for quite a while. Then I had to cancel that and install it from Terminal, which proceeded without any error, and now I can finally use it again on Fedora (Migrated today from Debian 11, where it installed without any issue from GNOME Software).
summary: Best app, can't help loving it!

description: Free, open source, and just as feature rich as its competitors, but with an actually intuitive GUI. It's not as advanced as Dorico, but it doesn't have to be. For $0, forever, this is a gift from God.
Great for composing music!
Please add option to force export of global menu. I use fildem global hud gnome extension and Musescore does not export menu global menu like it did with muse score 3.0
summary: Very Good Alternative to Finale / Sibelius

description: It is free and opensource software and is fully compatible on Linux without any issues. It is great for music students and professional musicians both, especially those who are into Classical music.

yea it works and all, but one of the main selling points of musescore4 is the new MuseSounds plugin, saddly only closed source and only available from the MuseHub download manager (also closed source). MuseScore is still awesome FOSS as it is, but yeah missing on MuseSounds is a bit sad

I love MuseScore but DO NOT use the Flatpak version if you want to use MuseSounds. You will need the AppImage as the Flatpak is unable to detect the MuseSampler Library. 

If you want to install the AppImage you can do:
$ ./MuseScore-4.x.x-xxxxxx install

The app refuses to boot.
And whenever I do try to start it, it breaks my audio! I have to restart my PC so I can hear through my headphones again! Very odd bug.
Fedora 39, for those who are wondering.
summary: Does not work, breaks all audio

description: Musescore does not start on Arch Linux. Flatpak does not work either. Not sure about other distros though
The official appimage doesn't work. This does.

Dieses Porgramm ist einfach klasse. All die Details, die man auf einer Partitur unterbringen kann, kennt es und die meisten werden auch durch die wählbaren Instrumente interpretiert.

Auch toll ist die riesige Musiksammplung auf musescore.com, auf die man für etwa 30€ im Jahr Zugriff bekommt.
summary: Großartiges Programm zum Musiknoten schreiben und komponieren

description: Funktioniert nicht über HDMI, nur über VGA. Bei HDMI sind die Grafiken weit größer als der Bildschirm und vieles ist nicht sichtbar und damit unerreichbar mit der Maus.
summary: Icons sind bei Verwendung eines HDMI-Kabels völlig überdimensioniert

description: He perdido muchos archivos que ni siquiera se pueden recuperar.

Cuando quisieron "enseñarme" a usar un software de este estilo pero totalmente restrictivo y pago, busque y encontre muse, supuse que no iba a ser tan bueno, pues, me trague mis suposiciones, es muy completo, y realmente un excelente editor de partituras, con varías opciones interesantes y con midi (totalmente cambiable y mejorable) para escuchar una previa de lo que estas Creando.

Desde hace más de 20 años usé siempre Sibelius. Hace unos 8 que descubrí Musescore, y ya me gustó, pero había cosas por las que seguía usando Sibelius, pero desde el año pasado me sorprendió y este año ya lo uso definitivamente. Además lo he sugerido a mis alumnos, pues es sencillo de instalar también en Windows.
Solo tiene un pequeño fallo y es que no reconoce las librerias de sonido de muse hub, por lo demás perfecto.

Logiciel qui depuis la version 3 est devenu très professionnel. 
Les + : multi-plateforme (Linux, Windows, Mac OS)
        import et export des différents formats de notation
		
Il manque le manche de guitare comme dans TuxGuitar ou GuitarPro. Dans la version Android on ne peut pas encore écrire, mais seulement lire.
summary: A mettre sur tout vos appareils

description: Trés puissant pour l'édition de partitions
Parfait pour éditer simplement des partitions de piano et exporter en mxl.

Поначалу было непросто перейти с других нотных редакторов. Но когда разобрался - теперь незаменимый софт. Для меня переход на этот нотный редактор оказался, как переход с windows на linux, отличные возможности при свободном ПО.
Всё супер. Местами интерфейс чуть кривоват, а так то что надо.
NICE! I CAN'T INSTALL IT ! AHOOOOOOOOOOM
还是不错的，可以编曲发布ddd
